text: [Music]
hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of the new foals LP holy fire
foals is a UK rock quintet whose third
full-length album right here holy fire I
have been maybe a little hesitant to
review because of just my strong dislike
for their last full-length album
total life forever in my opinion foals
used to be one of these young brash
up-and-coming bands in indie rock that
were just bursting with energy with all
these dance punk beats and in math rock
grooves and eccentric vocals they were
just a fireball of energy especially
with tracks like Casius and balloons
which both had some awesome horn parts
in them too I personally saw an
incredible amount of potential in what
the band was doing in their early stuff
but you know maybe they didn't actually
end up seeing it that way a lot like
another English rock group block party
it seemed like on their sophomore
full-length foals was trying to do away
with their original sound as quickly as
possible
however unlike block party I don't
really think on their sophomore
full-length LP foals tried to maintain
their youthful energy it seemed to me
that they were kind of in a rush to
mature the beats were at times danceable
but just not as hard not as Punk
influenced for sure and it wasn't a
total letdown I mean foals did supply
some pretty good singles with tracks
like this Orient as well as Miami but
just that really colorful vibrant and
and sort of rawness that the band had to
their early stuff was just kind of
sucked away and replaced with very
glistening string kissed choruses with
the occasional Radiohead style ambitious
climax now unfortunately this new LP is
not really that bold change in direction
I was kind of crossing my fingers for
it's not the return of that vibrant
energy however again Foles does not
leave me totally to hang out to dry they
never really do there's always at least
a handful of tracks that are great and
maybe on this new album I actually think
they have struck a somewhat better
balance between their softer more mature
side and that visceral energy that
they're able to conjure as a rock band
because there are some really good and
lively tracks on here and some
interesting moments where foals are
trying to make some pretty strange
chemical reactions between different
musical flavors like the track inhaler
which has these guitar chords that that
just balance with echo rhythmically
there's this pulsating drumbeat that
kind of reminds me of a band like
Maserati
there's all these soaring falsetto
vocals on the verses and then when the
chorus bursts in with this heavy ass
guitar riff it sounds like something Tom
Morello from Rage Against the Machine
could read and I think the execution of
kind of this new vibe that this riff
brings goes over really smoothly the
song my number is another favorite of
mine on here the song really pops with a
lot of catchy group vocals there's more
bouncy guitars more dance beats it
doesn't really go as hard on the chorus
like inhaler does but it's a really just
sweet danceable pop/rock single and to
me this song is really where the band
does very well for themselves in trying
to find a balance between making a dance
tune making a tune that you can move to
making a tune that's visceral but also
sounding maybe a little lighter a little
more flowery a little sweeter
you know it's dancey but it's not
superfluous and it has some really nice
little baby tiny funky shiny guitar
leads to those actually appear on quite
a few tracks here the song Providence is
another favorite of mine on here to the
end of this track is so heavy and noisy
and thick and climactic I didn't know
foals was still capable of creating a
sound that was that noisy in that
intense
anymore and everything that comes before
that point is fantastic as well just
these hard ass drum beats these jutting
distorted riffs it's so aggressive and
yet so dancey there's some interesting
interludes here with some atmospheric
ethereal keyboards as well as vocals
that feel like they have some like echo
e-dub effects on them for me this track
was like a near jaw-dropping moment
but then there are other tracks on here
kind of like the song bad habit where
it'll start off with a really cool beat
but it doesn't really get much more
interesting past that the song
progresses into this ultra smooth
glistening dance pop rock tune that
actually feels like maybe it would
actually be a Coldplay song if not for
all the Pali rhythms going on in the
background and again like on the album
total life forever folds just continue
to abuse reverb to the point where it
just sucks the meat it sucks the energy
out of their instrumentation and when
they explode on a chorus it just has no
bite whatsoever kind of like many of the
courses on that last Maccabees LP I kind
of feel the same way about the song late
night too which is a cool track has some
Radiohead esque vocal melodies it's got
a really dark vibe to a kind of
nocturnal but again those dance beats
really kind of keep foals from reaching
as high emotionally as the song could
potentially go these tracks that I sort
of mentioned negatively so far are even
really the worst moments to me they
don't so much ruin the album to me these
tracks are just ok they're tolerable
there are just more unbearable moments
than this in my opinion like the song
milk and black spiders which on this
track the mixing is terrible I don't
even know how it ended up on this LP mix
wise it sounds way different than any
other song on the album the reverb just
swallows up every single instrument on
here and all I can hear just the bad
strings tossed all over the track it
sounds like a really lackluster live
recording of somebody kind of holding a
microphone way back like thousands of
people are between them and the stage
and they're kind of holding their iPhone
in the air just taking a recording of
the band performing and the preload on
this thing the intro track the boring
chord progression and the and the guitar
leads and the heavy distorted riff that
comes in after it just sounds like one
big post-rock nightmare when I listen to
total life forever I didn't like it I
still don't like it but now I kind of
feel like I I know what the band is
going for foals intentions on holy fire
are a little bit clearer and you know it
would seem that they want to make dance
music they want to make dance rock and
dance pop but they want it to have this
delicate subtle kind of Flowery aura
about it the concept is great but I feel
like the band is yet to find a way to
combine these two elements without water
in each of them down with the other the
dance beats don't feel is hard they
don't move me they don't feel as
exciting and on the other end these
flowery moments that they go for feel
kind of bogged down feel boring they
don't feel emotionally powerful because
they're kind of locked into these dance
grooves instead of flowing beautifully
like something subtle should I feel like
that's kind of made apparent especially
on the last two tracks where the band
seems to ditch the dance beats a little
bit or mix them down so low that they
don't even really play a huge part in
the song and as a result you get a track
like moon which is this really just soft
spacious texture ballad that kind of
sounds like it is really like cigarettes
potential when it comes to the way that
all of these sounds kind of wander
through this very atmospheric mix with
these lonely lonesome vocals calling out
into the echo drenched night it's
actually beautiful and a really good
finisher to this album that was really
kind of spotty for me all the way
through though I have not enjoyed the
past two foals albums the band has shown
me again that they are still willing to
experiment to tinker to adjust and just
offer fans something new the next time
around even if it is only you know
slightly new envisioned but to me this
album was new enough and and more
likeable than the total life forever
to be completely honest I'm feeling a
decent 5 on on this record and um and
yeah that's that's about it what did you
think of it if you've given it a listen
did you love it did you hate it why and
what do you think I should review next
anthony Fantana folds forever
[Music]
[Music]
